column1: Common abnormalities include cysts in the pinna or skin tags.
Many children are born with ears that stick out.
Although people may comment on the ear shape, this condition is a variation of normal and is not linked with other disorders.

The doctor will: - Examine and test the child for other physical abnormalities of the kidneys, bones of the face, skull, and facial nerve - Ask if you have a family history of abnormal-shaped ears To determine whether the pinna is abnormal, the doctor will take measurements with a tape measure.
